it.polimi.se2019.server.controller

Class ControllerState

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.server.controller.ControllerState
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EndGameState, WaitingForEffects, WaitingForMainActions, WaitingForPowerUps, WaitingForReload, WaitingForRespawn

    public abstract class ControllerState
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the abstract of the state of the controller, every state needs to send a message to the client and receive a response to switch to another state or to to stay on the same state. A state can generate an error if the client selection is invalid.
    Author:
    FF

    • Method Detail

      • sendSelectionMessage

        public abstract void sendSelectionMessage(CommandHandler commandHandler)
        This needs to be implemented but sends to the client the action they need to perform
        Parameters:
        commandHandler - the player commandhandler

      • nextState

        public abstract ControllerState nextState(java.util.List<PlayerAction> playerActions,
                                          Game game,
                                          Player player)
        This method contains all the logic of a state. It checks whether the input is among those allowed in the state. If if fails it stays in the same state and keeps waiting for the same input, otherwise it performs the check and run methods of the actions, with possible modifications on the model and then goes to a new state.
        Parameters:
        playerActions - the list of actions received from the player
        game - the game on which to execute the actions
        player - the player sending the input
        Returns:
        the new state of the controller

      • sendErrorMessages

        public void sendErrorMessages(CommandHandler commandHandler)
        Sends an error message to the client by combining the currently stored error messages and then flush the currently stored error messages
        Parameters:
        commandHandler - the player commandhandler

      • addErrorMessage

        public static void addErrorMessage(java.lang.String errorMessage)
        Adds an error message to the list of stored error messages (errorMessages). These messages will be sent to the Views by the Controller and showed to the player, then the stored error messages will be flushed.
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - the message that will be stored

      • checkPlayerActionAndSaveError

        public static boolean checkPlayerActionAndSaveError(PlayerAction playerAction)
        Check if a playerAction can be run by executing the check on it, if it cannot be run add an error
        Parameters:
        playerAction - the action to check
